snippet: Masaaki Shirakawa, criticized for caution as the country endured years of deflation, said he would leave three weeks before his term ends.
abstract: Japanese central bank governor Masaaki Shirakawa says he has offered to step down on March 19, three weeks before the end of his term, under intense government pressure on the bank to take bolder steps to resuscitate the economy; Shirakawa has been criticized for caution as the country has endured years of deflation.
lead_paragraph: Masaaki Shirakawa, criticized for caution as the country endured years of deflation, said he would leave three weeks before his term ends.

headline.seo: Japan’s Central Bank Governor Offers to Depart Early
headline.main: At Odds With the Government, Japan’s Central Bank Chief Offers an Early Exit
